lines.content: * Represents the main application for managing tasks. The `Ujin` class integrates the user interface (UI),
* task list management, and file handling. It initializes the task list from a file, handles user commands,
* and performs actions like adding, deleting, and updating tasks.
* The application supports saving the task list to a file when the program is exiting using a shutdown hook.
* The list of tasks managed by the application.
* The user interface (UI) component for interacting with the user.
* Constructs a new `Ujin` application with the specified file path for loading and saving tasks.
* It initializes the UI and loads the task list from the specified file.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored and loaded from.
* Runs the application, displaying the welcome message and continuously reading and processing user commands.
* The task list is saved to the file when the program shuts down (via a shutdown hook).
* The entry point of the application. Initializes and runs the `Ujin` application with the task file.
* @param args The command-line arguments (not used in this implementation).
* Custom exception class for handling errors specific to the Ujin task management application.
* This exception is thrown when an error occurs that is specific to the application's logic,
* such as invalid commands or invalid data.
* Initializes a new exception without a message.
* Constructor for the `UjinException` that accepts a custom error message.
* This allows for more detailed exception handling by providing context for the error.
* @param message The error message explaining the reason for the exception.
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* This class inherits from the {@link Command} class and implements the execute behavior
/** The task to be added to the task list */
* Constructs an AddCommand object with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added to the list.
* Executes the command by adding the task to the task list and displaying the result through the UI.
* @param taskList The task list containing all tasks
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents an abstract base class for all command implementations.
* This class defines the fundamental structure for commands in the application, requiring
* subclasses to implement the {@code execute} method and optionally manage exit status.
* Indicates whether this command should terminate the application.
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui);
* Checks if this command represents an exit request.
* @return {@code true} if the command terminates the application, {@code false} otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* This class inherits from the {@link Command} class and implements the execute behavior
* The index of the to be deleted task.
* Constructs an DeleteCommand object with the specified task.
* @param index The index of the to be deleted task.
* Executes the command by deleting the task from the task list and displaying the result through the UI.
* @param taskList The task list containing all tasks
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to exit from the system.
* This class inherits from the {@link Command} class
* and implements the execute behavior of exiting.
* Executes the command by exiting the system and displaying goodbye message through the UI.
* @param taskList The task list containing all tasks.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Command that handles finding tasks that match a given keyword in their description.
* This class extends {@link Command} and allows searching through a list of tasks
* to find those whose description contains the specified keyword.
private final TaskList MATCHLIST = new TaskList();
* Initializes the command with the provided keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Executes the find command by searching through the given task list and finding tasks
* whose descriptions contain the specified keyword. Matching tasks are added to a list
* and displayed to the user via the {@link Ui#findTasks(TaskList)} method.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to search through.
* @param ui The UI instance used to display the results to the user.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to list all tasks from the task list.
* This class inherits from the {@link Command} class and implements the execute behavior
* Executes the command by listing all the tasks through the UI.
* @param taskList The task list containing all tasks.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to mark or unmark the task.
* This class inherits from the {@link Command} class
* and implements the execute behavior of marking or unmarking.
/** Indicates whether to mark (true) or unmark (false) the task */
/** The 1-based index of the task in the task list to be marked/unmarked */
* Constructs a MarkerCommand with the specified mark status and task index.
* @param marked {@code true} to mark the task as done, {@code false} to unmark it
* @param index The 1-based index position of the task in the task list
* Executes the command by updating the task's mark status and displaying the result through the UI.
* The task index is converted to 0-based internally for list operations.

* @param ui The user interface handler for displaying messages
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for parsing user input commands
* and returning the appropriate {@link Command} object based on the input.
* It can handle various types of commands such as adding tasks, marking tasks,
* deleting tasks, and others. This class uses a simple string parsing technique
* and splits the command into tokens to determine the action to perform.
* Parses the given command string and returns a corresponding {@link Command}
* object. The command string is split into tokens to identify the task type
* and create the appropriate {@link Command} subclass instance.
* @param command The command string to parse.
* @param ui The {@link Ui} object used to display error messages.
* @return A {@link Command} object that corresponds to the parsed command.
* @throws UjinException If the command is unrecognized or invalid.
public static Command parse(String command, Ui ui) throws UjinException{

* Helper method that splits a string containing task information into

* The {@code TaskProcessor} class provides utility methods for handling tasks
* by converting them to text for file storage and reading them from files.
* It is responsible for serializing tasks into a text format and deserializing
* them back into their respective {@link Task} subclasses, such as {@link Todo},
* {@link Deadline}, and {@link Event}. This class also handles reading and
* writing tasks from/to a file, allowing task persistence.
* A {@link DateTimeFormatter} used for formatting and parsing date and time
protected static DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm");
* Writes the tasks from the given {@link TaskList} to a file at the specified

* {@link #taskToText(Task)} method, and the tasks are appended to the file.
* @param taskList The {@link TaskList} containing tasks to write to the file.
* @param filePath The path of the file where tasks will be saved.
public static void writeTasksToFile(TaskList taskList, String filePath) {

* Reads tasks from the file located at the specified {@code filePath} and

* @param filePath The path of the file from which tasks will be read.

* @param task The {@link Task} object to convert to text.

* a {@link Task} object. The string is split by the delimiter "|" and
* parsed based on the task type to create the appropriate task subclass..
* @param text The string representation of a task.

This class provides methods to retrieve the deadline and display the task

* and a start and end time to define when the event takes place. Both times are represented

*

This class provides methods to retrieve the start and end times and display the task
* in a user-friendly string format with the event's time range included.

public Event(String description, String start, String end) {

* Represents a task with a description and a completion status. A task can be marked as
* done or undone, and it has a description that provides more details about the task.
* This class provides methods to manage the task's completion status, retrieve the task's
* description, and display a user interface string representation of the task's status and description.
* The status of the task, where {@code true} means the task is done and {@code false}
* means the task is not completed.
* Constructs a {@link Task} with the given description. The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns a status icon for this task. A task that is done is marked with "X",
* while a task that is not done is marked with a space.
* @return A string representing the task's status icon.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status and description.
* The status is displayed as "[X]" for completed tasks and "[ ]" for incomplete tasks.
* @return A string representation of the task.
* Returns the description of the task.
* @return A string representing the task's description.
* Returns whether the task is completed or not.
* @return {@code true} if the task is completed, {@code false} otherwise.

* @return A {@link LocalDateTime} object representing the parsed date and time.
* Represents a list of tasks. This class provides methods for managing the collection
* of tasks, including adding, deleting, and retrieving tasks.
* Tasks are stored in a {@link List}, and operations on the list can be performed using
* the available methods, such as adding a task, removing a task, and getting a task by its index.
* The list of tasks in the task list.
* Constructs a {@link TaskList} with the specified list of tasks.
* @param li A list of {@link Task} objects to initialize the task list.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param t The {@link Task} to be added to the list.
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* @return The number of tasks in the task list.
* Deletes the task at the specified index from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* Retrieves the task at the specified index from the task list.
* @param i The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The {@link Task} at the specified index.
* Represents a todo task that extends the {@link Task} class. A todo task is a type of task
* that does not have any specific date or time associated with it. It is simply a task that
* This class provides a specific string representation for todo tasks, which includes
* the task type identifier "[T]" followed by the task's description and completion status.
* Constructs a {@link Todo} task with the specified description. The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the todo task. The format is "[T]" followed by the task's
* @return A string representation of the todo task.
* Represents the user interface (UI) of the application. The UI is responsible for displaying
* messages to the user and reading input from the user. It handles various user interactions
* such as showing welcome messages, displaying tasks, and handling errors.
* The UI includes methods for showing various types of output, such as task additions,
* deletions, marking tasks as done or not done, and listing tasks. It also provides input
* The name of the chatbot used in the UI interaction.
* A string constant representing a horizontal line used for visual separation in the UI.
* Displays a welcome message, including the bot's logo and a greeting.
* The message includes a horizontal line separator for clarity.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?\n");
* Reads a user input command from the console.
* @return The user input as a string.
* Displays a horizontal line separator in the UI.
* Displays an error message in the UI.
* @param error The error message to be displayed.
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been added.
* @param newTask The task that was added.
* @param size The current size of the task list.
public void addedTask(Task newTask, int size) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + newTask + '\n');
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.\n");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been deleted.
* @param deletedTask The task that was deleted.
* @param size The current size of the task list.
public void deletedTask(Task deletedTask, int size) {
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + deletedTask);
System.out.println("Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.\n");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n");
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been unmarked (set as not done).
* @param task The task that was unmarked.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n");
* Displays the list of tasks in the task list.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to be displayed.
* Displays the list of tasks that match a search keyword.
* This method prints out each matching task in the provided {@link TaskList}.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to display, containing the tasks that matched the search criteria.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
* Displays a farewell message when the program ends.
* The message includes a thank you note and a goodbye message.
System.out.println("Thank you for chatting with " + BOTNAME);
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n");
